intro: Myginda gongonha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the genus Saintpaulia and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. It is popular as a houseplant due to its compact size and long blooming season. Myginda gongonha is also valued for its ability to purify indoor air and enhance the aesthetic of any interior space.
